# 1. Installing and loading packages usign `pacman`


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, ggstatsplot)
```
:::


# 2. Loading the data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
set.seed(1234)
```
:::


# 3. ggstatsplot

## 3.1 Histogram

### 3.1.1 Histogram with Parametric method 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p <- gghistostats(data = exam, 
             x = ENGLISH, 
             type = "p", 
             test.value = 60,
             bin.args = list(color ="black", 
                             fill = "lightblue", 
                             alpha = 0.7),
             normal.curve = FALSE, 
             normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 2),
             xlab = "English Scores")
p
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
extract_stats(p)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

### 3.1.2 Histogram with Non-parametric method 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p1 <- gghistostats(data = exam, 
             x = ENGLISH, 
             type = "np", 
             test.value = 60,
             bin.args = list(color ="black", 
                             fill = "lightblue", 
                             alpha = 0.7),
             normal.curve = FALSE, 
             normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 2),
             xlab = "English Scores")
p1
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
extract_stats(p1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

### 3.1.3 Histogram with Robust method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p2 <- gghistostats(data = exam, 
             x = ENGLISH, 
             type = "robust", 
             test.value = 60,
             bin.args = list(color ="black", 
                             fill = "lightblue", 
                             alpha = 0.7),
             normal.curve = FALSE, 
             normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 2),
             xlab = "English Scores")
p2
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 3.1.4 Histogram with Bayes method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p3 <- gghistostats(data = exam, 
             x = ENGLISH, 
             type = "bayes", 
             test.value = 60,
             bin.args = list(color ="black", 
                             fill = "lightblue", 
                             alpha = 0.7),
             normal.curve = TRUE, 
             normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 1, 
                                      color = "red"),
             xlab = "English Scores")
p3
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## 3.2 ggdotplotstats()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggdotplotstats(data = exam,
               x = ENGLISH,
               y = CLASS,
               title = "",
               xlab = "")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 3.3 ggwithinstats()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_new <- exam %>%
            pivot_longer(cols = ENGLISH:SCIENCE,
                         names_to = "SUBJECT",
                         values_to = "SCORES")

ggwithinstats(data = filter(exam_new, 
                            SUBJECT %in% c("MATHS", "SCIENCE"), 
                            CLASS %in% c("3A")),
              x = SUBJECT,
              y = SCORES,
              type = "p")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 3.4 ggscatterstats()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggscatterstats(data = exam,
               x = MATHS,
               y = ENGLISH,
               marginal = TRUE,
               label.var = ID,
               label.expression = ENGLISH > 90 & MATHS > 90)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
